      29             : 
      30             : /**
      31             :  * Object that encapsulates HTML text-specific editing rules.
      32             :  *
      33             :  * To be a good citizen, edit rules must live by these restrictions:
      34             :  * 1. All data manipulation is through the editor.
      35             :  *    Content nodes in the document tree must <B>not</B> be manipulated
      36             :  *    directly.  Content nodes in document fragments that are not part of the
      37             :  *    document itself may be manipulated at will.  Operations on document
      38             :  *    fragments must <B>not</B> go through the editor.
      39             :  * 2. Selection must not be explicitly set by the rule method.
      40             :  *    Any manipulation of Selection must be done by the editor.
      41             :  */
      42             : class TextEditRules : public nsIEditRules
      43             :                     , public nsITimerCallback
      44             : {

      78             :   /**
      79             :    * Handles the newline characters either according to aNewLineHandling
      80             :    * or to the default system prefs if aNewLineHandling is negative.
      81             :    *
      82             :    * @param aString the string to be modified in place.
      83             :    * @param aNewLineHandling determine the desired type of newline handling:
      84             :    *        * negative values:
      85             :    *          handle newlines according to platform defaults.
      86             :    *        * nsIPlaintextEditor::eNewlinesReplaceWithSpaces:
      87             :    *          replace newlines with spaces.
      88             :    *        * nsIPlaintextEditor::eNewlinesStrip:
      89             :    *          remove newlines from the string.
      90             :    *        * nsIPlaintextEditor::eNewlinesReplaceWithCommas:
      91             :    *          replace newlines with commas.
      92             :    *        * nsIPlaintextEditor::eNewlinesStripSurroundingWhitespace:
      93             :    *          collapse newlines and surrounding whitespace characters and
      94             :    *          remove them from the string.
      95             :    *        * nsIPlaintextEditor::eNewlinesPasteIntact:
      96             :    *          only remove the leading and trailing newlines.
      97             :    *        * nsIPlaintextEditor::eNewlinesPasteToFirst or any other value:
      98             :    *          remove the first newline and all characters following it.
      99             :    */
     100             :   static void HandleNewLines(nsString& aString, int32_t aNewLineHandling);

     306             : class MOZ_STACK_CLASS AutoLockRulesSniffing final

     316             :

     331             : class MOZ_STACK_CLASS AutoLockListener final

     337             :   {
     338           0 :     if (mEnabled) {
     339           0 :       mOldState = *mEnabled;
